description: From Dutch tafereel (“panel, picture”), diminutive of tafel (“table”), from Latin tabula (“table”).

entries.meaning: (nautical) The flat upper part of a ship's stern above the transom, often decorated with carvings.

examples: A true Chinese junk is a great curiosity; the model must have been taken originally from a bread-trough, being broad and square at both ends—when light, (I speak of a large one,) it is full thirty feet from the surface of the water to the tafferel, or the highest part of the poop.
